tasks: Review fundamentals of User Research & Validation
Document your learning in a journal
Practice User Research & Validation through small projects
Get feedback from peers or mentors
Analyze case studies in your focus area
Apply new skills to a real project
Create a portfolio piece showcasing your work
Share your progress with the community
Review and reflect on your growth

resources.readup: As an Explorer UX designer, you have the unique opportunity to shape the future of products and experiences. By leveraging your skills in user research, collaboration, and product thinking, you can drive meaningful change and create products that truly meet the needs of users.

resources.title: 10 Usability Heuristics for User Interface Design
resources.description: 7 10 Usability Heuristics for User Interface Design ================================================= Jakob Nielsen ![](https://media.nngroup.com/medi...

topics.name: Understanding Usability Heuristics
topics.summary: Exploring usability heuristics will help Explorer designers understand the principles of user-centered design and improve their UX fundamentals.
practice_points: Analyze 3 existing products using the 10 Usability Heuristics for User Interface Design guide and identify areas for improvement
Create a mind map illustrating the relationships between each heuristic and its corresponding principles

topics.name: Aesthetic-Usability Effect: Visual Design Principles
topics.summary: Learning about the Aesthetic-Usability Effect will enable Explorer designers to create visually appealing and user-friendly interfaces.
practice_points: Design 3 visual design concepts using the principles of the Aesthetic-Usability Effect, including typography, color palette, and imagery

topics.name: Conducting User Research: Introduction to User Interviews
topics.summary: Gaining experience in conducting user interviews will help Explorer designers develop essential research skills and improve their ability to validate design decisions.
practice_points: Conduct 2 user interviews using the Jobs-to-be-Done framework and document findings, including quotes and insights
